recipes.label: The Last Pieces of the Great Work?
recipes.startdescription: We have the Core, its fuel, the Compass, the Key, the Mysteries of Opening. Now we require only the season of the Forge's most furious incandescence.

recipes.label: The Last Pieces of the Great Work?
recipes.startdescription: We have the Core, its fuel, the Compass, the Key. Even all these will not be enough. We must prepare the way for our Shaper with the Mysteries of Opening.

recipes.label: The Last Pieces of the Great Work?
recipes.startdescription: We have the Core, its fuel, the Compass. We still need the Biting Key.

recipes.label: The Last Pieces of the Great Work?
recipes.startdescription: We have the Core and its fuel. We need our blinded Compass, to find the flaw in the world.

recipes.label: The Last Pieces of the Great Work?
recipes.startdescription: We have the Core: we must have blue gold to feed it.

recipes.label: The Gate Opens Outwards?
recipes.startdescription: We need our noble guest's co-operation.

recipes.label: The Gate Opens Outwards?
recipes.startdescription: The Gate will not open Outwards without its unlawed Key.

recipes.label: The Gate Opens Outwards?
recipes.startdescription: We'll need a Watchman's Glass for our Illuminated One to enact the utmost illumination.

recipes.label: The Gate Opens Outwards?
recipes.startdescription: Centipede always knows the way. We'll need her secrets.

recipes.label: The Gate Opens Outwards?
recipes.startdescription: The Watchman's Eye was opened, not in the usual way, but with a knife. We will need what it bled.

recipes.label: The Gate Opens Outwards?
recipes.startdescription: Certainly the Gate might open without Witnesses, but without Witnesses to be illuminated, how can we fulfil the Watchman's enactment? The Watchman is not compassionate.

recipes.label: The Last Elements of the Vitulation?
recipes.startdescription: Our particular spices must be particularly prepared. All else is ready.

recipes.label: The Last Elements of the Vitulation?
recipes.startdescription: Without the Unceasing Mysteries, the Vitulation will not reach the intensity we require.

recipes.label: The Last Elements of the Vitulation?
recipes.startdescription: We need the most powerful Grail influence we can muster.

recipes.label: The Last Elements of the Vitulation?
recipes.startdescription: No Vitulation would be a Vitulation without the Chalice Murmurous.

recipes.label: The Last Elements of the Vitulation?
recipes.startdescription: We cannot begin the Vitulation without sufficient guests. Our Delight cannot go hungry.

recipes.label: The Last Elements of the Vitulation?
recipes.startdescription: We cannot begin the Vitulation without the correct flavouring, for myself and for the others of the Host.

recipes.label: Private Performances?
recipes.startdescription: To satisfy my benefactor, I'll need to exert my abilities, and ensure I look my best. That always has a cost.

recipes.label: Money
recipes.startdescription: This does nothing; but perhaps I might eventually find another way to invest my funds in my future. If I have a future.

recipes.label: Health
recipes.startdescription: I have grown strong, but I must still devote my Health to a day's work.

recipes.label: Vitality
recipes.startdescription: This isn't a matter for work; but I could Study it to increase my Health.
recipes.comments: Not currently possible with restrictions on work primary slot

recipes.label: Erudition
recipes.startdescription: This isn't a matter for work; but I could Study it to increase my Reason.
recipes.comments: Not currently possible with restrictions on work primary slot

recipes.label: Glimmering
recipes.startdescription: This isn't a matter for work; but I could Study it to increase my Passion.
recipes.comments: Not currently possible with restrictions on work primary slot

recipes.label: Contentment
recipes.startdescription: One cannot earn a living by being happy. But happiness may be something to cling to, when the night closes round me.
recipes.comments: Not currently possible with restrictions on work primary slot

recipes.label: Fulfilling a Commission
recipes.startdescription: I need the right Lore, and I need to dedicate my abilities to the work. [The Commission description will remind you what Lore you need.]

recipes.label: Fulfilling a Commission?
recipes.startdescription: If I use Work with the right Lore fragment, I can create a manuscript to fulfil this Commission. I'll need to Talk to my Patron about this Commission when it's finished.

recipes.label: The Seventh Mark?
recipes.startdescription: The Seventh Mark is the Conflagration of the Heart. I am close: close as the flame is to the candle. I will need all the power of the Forge I can muster, to at least the thirty-sixth degree of intensity.

recipes.label: The Seventh Mark?
recipes.startdescription: The Seventh Mark is the Conflagration of the Heart. I will first need to achieve the Sixth Mark.

recipes.label: A quicker way to the Seventh Mark?
recipes.startdescription: The Seventh Mark is the Feast of the True Birth. I am close: close as blood to the heart. I will need more... but the Grail once sacrificed one she had loved, and those sacrifices are precious to her. If I am willing to sacrifice a lover, I will need power to only the twenty-seventh degree of intensity.

recipes.label: The Seventh Mark?
recipes.startdescription: The Seventh Mark is the Feast of the True Birth. I am close: close as blood to the heart. I will need all the power of the Grail I can muster, to at least the thirty-sixth degree of intensity.

recipes.label: The Seventh Mark?
recipes.startdescription: The Seventh Mark is the Feast of the True Birth. I will first need to achieve the Sixth Mark.

recipes.label: The Seventh Mark?
recipes.startdescription: The Seventh Mark is the Incursus. I am close: close as the light to the shadow's edge. I will need all the power of the Lantern I can muster, to at least the thirty-sixth degree of intensity.

recipes.label: The Seventh Mark?
recipes.startdescription: The Seventh Mark is the Incursus. I will first need to achieve the Sixth Mark.

recipes.label: Summon a mighty creature of the Forge of Days?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more. To conjure a thing of fire and Glory, I'll need a great power of Forge; a significant power of Knock; and some Lantern.

recipes.label: King Crucible, again?
recipes.startdescription: Am I considering summoning King Crucible? King Crucible is already in the world.

recipes.label: King Crucible, already?
recipes.startdescription: Am I considering summoning King Crucible? He's still stoking his fires in the Mansus.

recipes.label: King Crucible? Really?
recipes.startdescription: I consumed King Crucible's cindered remains. He will be wroth with me. It does not to do summon a Name of the Forge who is wroth with you.

recipes.label: Summon a mighty creature of the Red Grail?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. To conjure a thing of blood and change, I'll need a great power of Grail; a significant power of Knock; and some Forge.

recipes.label: Ezeem, again?
recipes.startdescription: Am I considering summoning Ezeem? Ezeem is already in the world.

recipes.label: Ezeem, already?
recipes.startdescription: Am I considering summoning Ezeem? Ezeem is still sulking in the Mansus.

recipes.label: Summon something unusual?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. With enough Lantern, a significant degree of Knock, and a teasing taste of secrets, perhaps I can conjure someone interesting.

recipes.label: The Baldomerian, again?
recipes.startdescription: Am I considering summoning the Baldomerian? She's already in the world.

recipes.label: The Baldomerian, already?
recipes.startdescription: Am I considering summoning the Baldomerian? She's still resting in the Mansus.

recipes.label: Summon a creature of the Forge of Days?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. To call forth this smoky, tricksy entity, I'll need a significant power of Forge, as well as a little Winter and Knock.

recipes.label: Summon a creature of the Red Grail?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. To call forth this monstrous, if affectionate, entity, I'll need a significant intensity of Grail, and a little Moth and Knock.

recipes.label: Summon a thing from behind mirrors?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. To call forth this subtle, fragile, murderous thing, I'll need a significant intensity of Lantern, and a little Knock and Edge.

recipes.label: Summon a creature of the Thunderskin?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. To call forth this merry, ceaseless, merciless thing, I'll need a significant intensity of Heart, and a little Knock and Edge.

recipes.label: Summon a creature of the Sun-in-Rags?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. To call forth this chilly and shining thing, I'll need a very significant intensity of Winter, and a little Knock and Edge.

recipes.label: Summon one of the throng of the Dead?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more power. To call forth this wretched, voiceless thing, I'll need Winter at the fourth intensity, and a little Knock and Heart.

recipes.label: Renew a Shattered Risen with the power of the Cartographer of Scars?
recipes.startdescription: It is harder to maintain a Shattered Risen than it is to raise one. But with enough Winter aspect, and enough Edge, I might keep my Shattered Risen moving. Or I might employ it to summon a greater spirit.

recipes.label: Renew a Burgeoning Risen with the power of the Ring-Yew?
recipes.startdescription: A Burgeoning Risen will not stay contained for long. But with enough Winter aspect, and enough Moth, I might keep my work stable a little longer. Or I might employ it to summon a greater spirit.

recipes.label: Infuse a corpse with the power of the Cartographer of Scars?
recipes.startdescription: I've found a useful conjunction of aspects, but I need more. With some Winter aspect, a little Edge, and a Corpse, I might create a brutal servant.

recipes.label: Infuse a corpse with the power of the Ring-Yew?
recipes.startdescription: With some Winter aspect, a little Moth, and a Corpse, I might create a cunning servant.

recipes.label: A Threshold ascension?
recipes.startdescription: A Threshold ascension requires seven Lock-scars, and Knock aspect to the twenty-fourth intensity.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here, if I add Lantern, or Heart, or Winter.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here. If I add Winter, I might contact something smoky; if I add Lantern, I might contact an incandescent power.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here. If I add Moth, I might contact something shapeless; if I add Forge, I might contact a seductive, savage power.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here. If I add Edge, I might contact something irrepressible; if I add Winter, I might summon up one of the Dead.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here. If I add Edge, I might bring something out from behind mirrors; if I add Forge, I might contact something incandescent.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here. If I add Grail, I might contact something shapeless.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here. If I add enough Lantern, who knows what I could attract?

recipes.label: Winter
recipes.startdescription: There are possibilities here, if I add Edge, or Heart, or Forge.

recipes.label: Reason's Glory?
recipes.startdescription: With at least 5 Lantern and 1 Edge, I could use the mystic discipline called Reason's Glory to transform my Passion to Reason.

recipes.label: Passion's Gyre?
recipes.startdescription: With at least 5 Moth and 1 Edge, I could use the ecstatic practice called Passion's Gyre to transform my Reason to Passion.

recipes.label: Forge's Redemption?
recipes.startdescription: With at least 5 Forge and 1 Grail, I could use the forbidden procedure known as Forge's Redemption to return Decrepitude to Health.

recipes.label: The End is Beautiful?
recipes.startdescription: With at least 5 Winter and 1 Lantern, I could beseech the Hour of endings, the Sun-in-Rags, to destroy someone... but not someone in particular. The Sun-in-Rags alone will choose.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: Edge is the aspect of battle and of struggle. If I add Knock, I might be able to attempt a summoning; if I add Lantern or Moth, I could enact a battle in my own soul.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: Forge is the aspect that transforms and destroys. If I add Knock, I might be able to attempt a summoning; or if I have grown decrepit, then if I add Grail, perhaps I could renew my body.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: Grail is the aspect of appetite, blood, and birth. If I add Knock, I might be able to attempt a summoning; or if I have grown decrepit, then if I add Forge, perhaps I could renew my body.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: Heart is the aspect of preservation, but also of ceaseless motion. If I add Knock, I might be able to attempt a summoning.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: A summoning begins with Knock, but it usually requires two other aspects besides. If I don't use Knock, I might find other occult operations besides summoning.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: A summoning begins with Knock; but I will need at least a little more Knock.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.comments: extremely specific and probably unnecessary exclusion with the pillar, but it caught one person once
recipes.startdescription: Lantern is the principle of the secret place sometimes called the House of the Sun, and of the light above it. If I add Knock, I might be able to attempt a summoning. If I add Edge, I can try to conquer my Passion with Reason. If I add Winter, I can attempt a foolish, beautiful magic.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: Moth is the wild and perilous aspect of chaos and yearning. If I add Knock, I might be able to attempt a summoning. If I add Edge, I can try to drown my Reason in Passion.

recipes.label: Summoning Something?
recipes.startdescription: Secret Histories describe the unknown complexities of the world, and its many pasts. They're not usually used directly in the invisible arts, but if I add Knock, who knows what might be possible?

recipes.label: Winter
recipes.startdescription: Winter is the aspect of silence, of endings, and of those things that are not entirely dead. If I add Knock, I might be able to attempt a summoning. If I add Lantern, I can attempt a foolish, beautiful magic.

recipes.label: Rites
recipes.startdescription: Each rite can be used for many purposes. For a summoning, I must begin by calling upon the power of the Knock, which will open the way.

recipes.label: Not Enough, Not Yet
recipes.startdescription: Not yet enough. The Forge of Days will not attend unless I can merit her attention. I need Forge power of at least the sixth intensity.

recipes.label: Not Enough, Not Yet
recipes.startdescription: Not yet enough. The Red Grail will not attend unless I can merit her attention. I need Grail power of at least the sixth intensity.

recipes.label: Not Enough, Not Yet
recipes.startdescription: Not yet enough. The Red Grail will not attend unless I can merit her attention. I need Grail power of at least the sixth intensity.

recipes.label: Not Enough, Not Yet
recipes.startdescription: Not yet enough. The Watchman will not attend unless I can merit his attention. I need Lantern power of at least the sixth intensity.

recipes.label: Lost Colours?
recipes.startdescription: I hunger for what is lost. The way to that lies through another hunger. There is a secret I must study.

recipes.label: Second Thoughts?
recipes.startdescription: It was the right decision. And yet... [There may still be time enough to Study the file before it is gone forever.]

recipes.label: A Great Work?
recipes.startdescription: The final fulfilment of a Desire is often a conclusion. It is not enough to hope. I stand or fail on my deeds. [Desires are often the means to winning a game. The Desire for Sensation or Power or Enlightenment will require a great ritual. But there are other, even rarer, Desires, especially in the Ghoul, Priest and Dancer expansions. ]
